Changes are made to the input signal via transformation \\( f(x) = x(t) + e^{at} \\), with a being a constant.

If the input signal \\( x(t) \\) is replaced by the transformed signal \\( f(x) \\) at t = 0, and the system is allowed to evolve under the original convolution setup without further changes, will \\( y(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if the original \\( x(t) \\) was used?
Explanation: The transformation \\( f(x) = x(t) + e^{at} \\) alters the input signal, resulting in the convolution integral producing a different output. The additive term \\( e^{at} \\) modifies each integral computation throughout the duration to T and affects the resulting output function depending on the properties of \\( h(t) \\).
